Risk_of_Bias: Moderate - open label but computer-generated randomization
Diagnostic_Criteria: First seizure episode, single small (<20mm) enhancing CT lesion, no neurological deficit
Control_Group_N: Not applicable - comparison of two treatment durations
Other_Demographics: Two patients had family history of NCC seizures
Corticosteroid_Type: Prednisolone 2 mg/kg/day for 7 days starting 2 days before albendazole
Antiepileptic_Drug: Not specified which, but all received antiepileptic drugs
Other_AE: Three patients had AEs to antiepileptic drugs (rash, Stevens-Johnson syndrome). No albendazole-related AEs
Comments: One-week albendazole was as effective as 4-week therapy for lesion resolution and seizure control. Most resolution occurred within first 3 months. Calcification rates similar between groups (19% vs 24.2%, p=0.433).
